keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, planned to shoot up Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport via a social media livestream.
His family alerted authorities after he streamed on social media expressing intent to 'shoot it up' at the airport.
Police found an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the airport terminal.
Cagle was arrested upon arrival at the airport, and body-camera footage shows officers apprehending him after he was recognized by photo.
He was charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
Cagle had a history of mental health struggles, including schizophrenia, and had previously expressed he was taking medication.
The incident was averted due to early warning from family members and timely law enforcement action.
Federal authorities are investigating how Cagle legally obtained the firearm, which he was not permitted to possess.
The event underscores the importance of social media vigilance and community reporting in preventing mass violence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, Billy Joe Cagle, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted law enforcement that he had streamed on social media expressing intent to 'shoot it up' at the airport. Officers found an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. Cagle, who had a history of mental health issues including schizophrenia, was apprehended upon arrival and charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon. The incident was averted due to early detection through community reporting, highlighting the critical role of social media vigilance and public cooperation in preventing mass violence at a globally significant airport.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Planning Mass Shooting on Social Media
